home.text_base_description: Architecturally significant contemporary residence in the upper Hollywood Hills. Spread over three floors, this luxury build has all the modern amenities one would expect from a premium residence of this standard. Custom details from the entry to the exterior, interior lift, Gaggenau appliances, fully automated music, alarm, blind and pool systems. Incredible design, numerous game and media rooms, all culminating in making this the ultimate celebrity enclave. Beyond the insane skyline views from every suite in the house, the 30' infinity pool and hot tub, which overlooks one of the best cityscape views in Los Angeles, the house has two large entertaining decks, decked with Italian porcelain, fire-pits and private seating areas to enjoy.

item.item: Built-In And Free Standing, Built-In BBQ, Cooktop - Gas, Double Oven, Microwave
Breakfast Area, Breakfast Counter / Bar, Dining Area, Family Kitchen, Kitchen Island, Living Room
Atrium, Bonus Room, Breakfast Bar, Separate Family Room, Great Room, Master Bedroom, Patio Covered, Patio Enclosed, Utility Room, Dining Room
Windows: Vertical Blinds, Custom Window Covering

Alarm System, Barbeque, Built-Ins, Cable, Dishwasher, Dryer, Electric Dryer Hookup, Elevator, Freezer, Garbage Disposal, Gas Dryer Hookup, Hood Fan, Ice Maker, Microwave, Water Line to Refrigerator, Phone System, Refrigerator, Range/Oven, Network Wire
2 Car Garage, Offsite, On street, Driveway - Concrete
Security Features: Fire Sprinklers, Smoke Detector, T.V., Fire and Smoke Detection System, Carbon Monoxide Detector(s)
Negative Edge/Infinity Pool, Pool Heated with Gas, Gunite Pool
In Ground Spa, Heated with Gas, Heated Spa, Gunite Spa
Taxes / Assessments, Location Details, Documents & Disclosures

Directions: From Sunset take N Doheny, right on Thrasher and then up on Bluejay Way, and then left on Sunset Plaza Dr till it turns into Appian Way. Continue East and the house can be found on the right hand side. Alternatively, if coming from Weho, go up Laural Canyon, turn left on Lookout Mountain, and continue until it turns into Appian Way.
